thread.title: WIAA modifies conference configurations for area schools
thread.title_full: WIAA modifies conference configurations for area schools

title: WIAA modifies conference configurations for area schools
text:
(0) Comments 
Stevens Point â€” Another audible has been called on conference realignment for Southeast Wisconsin. 
On Friday the WIAA Board of Control voted, 9-1, to modify the plan after 90 minutes of discussion and reaction from the affected schools. The plan will be up for first approval vote at the Board's Dec. 4 meeting. At that time the Board can approve, reject or modify the plan. If the Board approves it, then schools would have 40 days to appeal the decision 
If the plan receives final approval, it would take effect for the 2017-'18 school year. 
A large contingent of area administrators attended the meeting and almost all who spoke told the Board they were against the proposal presented by associate director Deb Hauser that would have placed 29 schools from Classic 8, Greater Metro, North Shore and Wisconsin Little Ten Conferences in the same conference grouping, giving them the chance to split themselves into divisions. 
Hauser then offered a revision to the plan and the Board approved those modifications. 
Here are the changes they approved: PROPOSED CONFIGURATION
